titlePart.text: LAND VEHICLES FOR TRAVELLING OTHERWISE THAN ON RAILS

titlePart.entryReference: wheels, castors, axles, increasing wheel adhesion
tyres, tyre inflation, tyre changing or repairing
connections between vehicles of a train or the like
vehicles for use on rail and road, amphibious or convertible vehicles
heating, cooling, ventilating or other air treating devices
windows, windscreens, non-fixed roofs, doors or similar devices, protective coverings for vehicles not in use
propulsion plant arrangements, auxiliary drives, transmissions, controls, instrumentation or dashboards
electric equipment or propulsion of electrically-propelled vehicles
passenger accommodation not otherwise provided for
adaptations for load transportation or to carry special loads or objects
vehicles, vehicle fittings or vehicle parts, not otherwise provided for
servicing, cleaning, repairing, supporting, lifting, or manoeuvring, not otherwise provided for
brake arrangements, brake control systems or parts thereof

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, the following terms are used with the meanings indicated:

titlePart.text: Steering of motor vehicles or trailers
titlePart.entryReference: steering devices applicable only to steerable undercarriages for aircraft

titlePart.text: Steering controls, i.e. means for initiating a change of direction of the vehicle
Connecting hubs to steering columns, e.g. adjustable
Tillers, i.e. hand levers operating on steering columns
Connecting steering column to steering gear
Alternative steering-control elements, e.g. for teaching purposes
remote controlled, i.e. by means not mounted on the vehicle
mechanically, e.g. by a non-load-bearing guide
using intermediate balls or the like
with worm engaging in sector or roller gear
characterised by type of power unit, e.g. piston and cylinder
for individually-pivoted wheels, e.g. on king-pins
the pivotal axes being situated in a single plane transverse to the longitudinal centre line of the vehicle
the pivotal axes being situated in more than one plane transverse to the longitudinal centre line of the vehicle, e.g. all-wheel steering

titlePart.entryReference: means for adjusting camber, castor, or toe-in

titlePart.text: Steering deflectable wheels not otherwise provided for
combined with means for inwardly-inclining vehicle body on bends
Steering endless tracks or the like
by differentially driving ground-engaging elements on opposite vehicle sides
by means of separate power sources
by means of a single main power source
using brakes or clutches as main steering-effecting means
using gearings with differential power outputs on opposite sides, e.g. twin- differential or epicyclic gears
differential power outputs being effected by additional power supply to one side, e.g. power originating from secondary power source
the additional power supply being supplied mechanically
the additional power supply being supplied hydraulically
Endless-track steering having pivoted bogie carrying track
Endless-track steering being effected by deflecting endless-track rollers or the like
Endless-track steering specially adapted for vehicles having both steerable wheels and endless track
Means on vehicle for adjusting camber, castor, or toe-in
built-up essentially of longitudinally and transversely arranged members
having a single longitudinal member supporting transverse members
in which the main member is plate-like
characterised by the vehicle type and not provided for in groups
Combined superstructure and frame, i.e. monocoque constructions
Parts or details thereof and not otherwise provided for

titlePart.entryReference: equipped with means for freeing wheels or tyres from foreign matter

titlePart.text: Parts or details thereof, e.g. mud-guard flaps
Running-boards, steps, or the like, as superstructure sub-unit
titlePart.entryReference: other arrangements of steps, ladders, or running-boards in vehicles
passenger vehicles specially adapted to co-operate with aircraft or terminal buildings

titlePart.text: for carrying large numbers of passengers, e.g. omnibus

titlePart.entryReference: in which a load-carrying element is movable

titlePart.text: Stabilising vehicle bodies without controlling suspension arrangements
Vehicle bodies not otherwise provided for
Fittings for identifying vehicles in case of collision
Fittings for marking or recording collision areas
Spare wheel stowing, holding, or mounting arrangements
Motor vehicles or trailers classified according to type
Parts or accessories thereof not otherwise provided for
titlePart.entryReference: frames for vehicles of special type

titlePart.text: Motor vehicles or trailers predominantly for carrying passengers
for large numbers of passengers, e.g. omnibus
having means for preventing overturning or tipping
Motor vehicles characterised by the driver not being seated
the driver standing in the vehicle

titlePart.entryReference: traction couplings other than fifth-wheel couplings

titlePart.text: comprising a uniaxle tractor unit and a uniaxle trailer unit
comprising a vehicle carrying an essential part of the other vehicle's load by having supporting means for the front or rear part of the other vehicle
with means for preventing accidental uncoupling
with tracks and additional ground wheels
with tracks and alternative ground wheels, e.g. changeable from endless-track vehicle into wheeled vehicle and vice versa
Arrangement, location, or adaptation of driving sprockets
Arrangement, location, or adaptation of rollers
of locked-girder type, i.e. for preventing back-flexing
of continuously-flexible type, e.g. rubber belts
Vehicles characterised by having other propulsion or other ground-engaging means than wheels or endless track
with ground-engaging propulsion means, e.g. walking members
having other than ground-engaging propulsion means, e.g. having propellers
Trailers with driven ground wheels or the like
driven from propulsion unit on trailer
Vehicles characterised by the arrangement or number of the wheels, e.g. four wheels in diamond pattern
titlePart.entryReference: single-track vehicles with or without auxiliary wheels

titlePart.text: with two road wheels in tandem on the longitudinal centre line of the vehicle
with two other wheels which are coaxial
with variable number of ground-engaging wheels, e.g. with some wheels arranged higher than others, or with retractable wheels
Motor vehicles or trailers not otherwise provided for

titlePart.entryReference: vehicles carrying living accommodation, e.g. caravans,

titlePart.text: Designing, manufacturing, or assembling motor vehicles or trailers, not otherwise provided for
